column1: # New Localizations for the post 0.7 buildings, for Númenóreans/Dúnedain/Gondorians/Arnoreans

column3: FRENCH

column2: A well fortified fortress includes towers, often as part of the walls.

column1: #Walls, gives fortlevel, garrison size and income

column2: The Númenóreans and their descendants are renowned for their massive walls. Walls additionally boost income and the garrison size.

column1: #Keeps, slight levy and garrison increase, but extra money and tech growth

column2: The Dúnedain Keeps and Amories are skillfully made.

column1: #Training grounds, gives morale and reinforce rate

column2: Soldiers build their skills at the Training Grounds, giving morale and reinforcements.
There are some families living in the castle.
There are a substantial amount of people living by the castle
There is a small town supporting the castle.
The community near the castle is large enough to be a town.
The community near the castle is the size of a large town.
The castle community is a substantial city, generating much wealth.
Long contact with the Elves has given the Dúnedain great skill at healing.
With this fire signal, you will be notified quickly in case of invasion, and you'll be better prepared for defence as a result.
column3: Grâce au feu d'alarme, vous serez averti plus rapidement en cas d'invasion, ce qui vous permettra d'être mieux préparé.

column2: The Dúnedain have installed secret rooms in their territories to defend themselves in case of invasion. Difficult to find, they offer greater protection.
column3: Les Dunedains se sont installés des salles secrètes sur leurs territoires, pour se protéger en cas d'invasion. Difficiles à trouver, elles offrent une protection plus grande.

column2: Forges are helpful for arming soldiers.
Apothecaries supply healing herbs and potions for your castle.
The Númenóreans were the greatest sea-farers of Middle-Earth, and that heritage is not forgotten.
The heritage is Númenor is preserved here.

column1: # Dunedain Barracks, heavy infantry and archers

column2: The Dúnedain are respected for the strength of their foot soldiers

column2: The Dúnedian have cavalry, and this building supports them.

The Rangers of Ithillien are skilled archers and trackers, the Rangers of Gondor.
The Knights of Arnor are an elite Heavy Calvary force, inspired by the Lancers of Rivendell
Experience in fighting mounted enemies has led Gondorians and Arnorians to keep large bodies of semi-professional Pikemen.

column2: The Men of the West, like most others, find that an organized central space makes everything work a little better.

column2: There are some stalls to tax.
There are enough merchants to perhaps qualify as a market.
There is a small Marketplace in this town.

column3: Respectable Marketplace

column2: The marketplace is substantial and wealthy.
The thriving Markets of this city are sources of great wealth.
The Bazaars of this city are famous worldwide.
The Men of The West trade using ships which range far and wide, bringing in commerce and wealth.
In addition to Houses of Lore, the men of the West build Archives, holding records of all transactions and affairs.
The Men of the West entomb their dead in solemn and well-built Tombs.

column1: ##Stable, gives light cavalry and some knights

column2: Cavalry is a vital component of most any army, and this building supports them.
Built in the early days or Arnor, the walls of Annúminas are an exmple of classic Númenórean legendary masonry-work.
column3: Une des quelques forteresses baties par les Númenoreéens.
La Salle des Rois

column2: Annúminas was the city of the Kings of Arnor, built on the shores of Lake Evendim.
column3: Annúminas est la grande capitale des Rois d'Arnor, fondée sur les rives du lac Evendim.

column2: After the Fall of Arnor, Annúminas fell into decay. Little by little, the people left for other cities, and the once great city was abandoned.
column3: Depuis la division de l'Arnor, Annuminas a perdu de son éclat. Petit à petit, les habitants sont partis pour d'autres villes, et la cité a été abandonnée.

column2: The Mighty Tower of Amon Sûl had been built during the days of Elendil the Tall, and stored one of the Palantiri of Arnor. It's one of the greatest fortress of Arnor, and the proud of the Men of the West.
column3: La Puissante Tour d'Amon Sûl a été construite au temps d'Elendil le Grand, et renfermait en son sein l'un des Palantiri d'Arnor. Cette puissante forteresse était l'une des places fortes les plus importantes d'Arnor, et une fierté pour les Hommes de l'Ouest.

column2: In 1409 of the Third Age, the legions of the Witch-king of Angmar besieged the Tower of Amon Sûl, and destroyed it, killing the King Arveleg I during the battle. Since this time, the Tower is ruins, and some shadows could be seen around the summit…
column3: En 1409 du Tiers-Âge, les Légions du Roi-Sorcier d'Angmar ont assiégé la Tour d'Amon Sûl, et l'ont détruite, tuant le Roi Argeleb I d'Arthedain durant la bataille. Depuis ce temps, la Tour est en ruine, et on peut voir des ombres inquiétantes roder à son sommet...

column2: Fornost Erain was the capital of Arthedain. This powerful city-fortress was built in the earlier yaers of Arnor, and its name neams "Northern Fortress of Kings."
column3: Fornost Erain est la capitale de l'Arthedain. Cette puissante cité-forteresse a été batie durant les premières années du Royaume d'Arnor, et son nom signifie "Forteresse du Nord des Rois"

column2: Since the fall of Fornost in TA 1974, the fortress has fallen into ruin. Now known as Deadman's Dike, only the Dúnedain ever walk there.
column3: Depuis la chute de Fornost en 1974 TA, la forteresse est tombée en ruines. Son nom a été changé en Deadman's Dike, et nul homme hormis les Dunedains n'y met les pieds.

column2: The Bridge of Tharbad a was where the North-South Road crossed the Gwathló River at the city of Tharbad.
column3: Le pont de Tharbad permettait à la route Nord-Sud de traverser la rivière Gwathló dans la ville de Tharbad.

column2: A great ring-wall of stone, like towering cliffs, encircling  the black impenetrable tower of Orthanc.
column3: Un grand anneau de murs en pierre entourant la sombre et imprénétrable Tour d'Orthanc.
Murs Numénoréens de Minas Tirith

column2: Minas Tirith (as Minas Anor) was built in SA 3320 by Anárion, brother of Isildur, second son of Elendil, and a High King of Arnor. It was built on seven levels, each delved into the hill, and about each was set a wall, and in each was a gate.
column3: Minas Tirith (à l'époque Minas Anor) a été construite en l'an 3320 du Second Age par Anárion, frère d'Isildur, second fils d'Elendil, and a Haut Roi de l'Arnor. La Cité a été construite sur sept niveaux, chacun creusé dans la roche, entouré d'un mur et protégé par une porte.
Murs Numénoréens de Minas Ithil

column2: Minas Ithil was founded in the Second Age by the Númenorean, Isildur, son of Elendil, as a fortress city to defend Gondor from Sauron in Mordor.
column3: Minas Ithil a été fondée au Second Age par Isildur, fils d'Elendil, pour servir de forteresse contre le Mordor.
Murs Numénoréens de Dol Amroth

column2: One of the few fortresses built by the Númenoreans.
column3: Une des quelques forteresses baties par les Númenoreéens.
La Grande Salle d'Osgiliath

column2: The Great Hall of Osgiliath was the joint throne room of Isildur and Anárion in the city of Osgiliath. Although the two brothers kept separate houses in Minas Ithil (Isildur) and Minas Anor (Anárion), their thrones were set side by side in the Great Hall.
column3: La Grande Salle d'Osgiliath était la salle du trône commune d'Isildur et Anárion dans la ville d'Osgiliath. Bien que les deux frères aint vécus dans des cités séparées, Minas Ithil pour Isildur et Minas Anor pour Anárion, leurs trônes furent placés côte à côte dans la Grande Salle.
Le Dôme des Etoiles

column2: The Dome of Stars is the Great Hall of the Kings in Osgiliath. The Kingdom of Gondor's chief Palantír was kept there.
column3: Le Dôme des Etoiles est la Grande Salle des Rois à Osgiliath. Le Palantir-Maître était gardé en ce lieu.
Ruines d'Osgiliath

column2: Once the capital of Gondor, the great city of Osgiliath was devastated by the Kin-Strife and the Great Plague, and was abandoned shortly after.

column3: La Tour d'Ecthelion

column2: The White Tower of Minas Tirith, containing the throne of the Kings of Gondor, and the hidden hall of the Palantír.
column3: La Tour Blanche de Minas Tirith, contenant le trône des Rois du Gondor, ainsi qu'une pièce secrète contenant le Palantir.
L'Étang Interdit

column2: Henneth Annûn is a secret place, and rare are the enemies who can come close to the Forbidden Pool.
column3: Henneth Annun est une place secrète, et rares sont les ennemis qui peuvent s'en approcher.
La Pierre d'Erech

column2: The Stone of Erech is a great black stone, spherical in shape and roughly six feet in diameter. It was half-buried at the top of the Hill of Erech. The Stone was a mysterious and eerie place, shunned by the people of the valley, who claimed it had fallen from the sky, and that it was haunted by restless spirits. In fact, the Stone had its origins in Númenor, and was brought to Erech after the Downfall by Isildur himself.
column3: La pierre d'Erech est une grande pierre noire, de forme sphérique et d'environ six pieds de diamètre. Elle a été à demi-enterré au sommet de la colline de Erech. La pierre est un lieu mystérieux et étrange, boudé par les habitants de la vallée, qui prétendent l'avoir vu tombé du ciel, et serait hantée par des esprits sans repos. En fait, la pierre avait ses origines à Númenor, et a été portée à Erech après la Chute par Isildur lui-même.

column2: The Argonath were a pair of massive north-facing carved statues, built flanking the river Andiun by the Gondorian Regent Minalcar (later Rómendacil II). They marked the official northern boundary of Gondor in the days of its glory.

The Argonath were a pair of massive north-facing carved statues, built flanking the river Andiun by the Gondorian Regent Minalcar (later Rómendacil II). They marked the official northern boundary of Gondor in the days of its glory.

column3: Grand port de Pelargir

column2: The major port of Gondor, and also one of the first settlements the Númenóreans founded in Middle-earth during the Second Age.
column3: Le plus grand port du Gondor mais aussi un des premiers endroits occupés par les Númenóréens lors du Second Age.

column2: A well fortified community includes towers, often as part of the walls.

column1: #Walls, gives fortlevel, garrison size and income

column2: The Númenóreans and their descendants are renowned for their massive walls. Walls additionally boost income and the garrison size.
(WiP) The Temple Guards are the elite infantry associated with the Temple.
There are some families living in the temple.
Thanks to to influence of the Elves, the Dúnedian hold Eru above all else.
